column4: hi all, hope you are doing well.  I might be missing something obvious about permissions or access but I have been trying for several months on and off to have my ubuntu web root be on a seperate NTFS partition and have not been able to get this to work. Is this just not possible?
surely it is possible, it is even easy.
check carefully that you mount it with the right 'uid=,gid=,umask=' parameters
by default NTFS filetrees are mounted as the logged in user, which isn't the web server user.
